head.title: M.T.A.'s Capital Plan Wins Final Approval

hedline.hl1: M.T.A.'s Capital Plan Wins Final Approval

block.p: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority's much-criticized $17 billion capital plan won final approval yesterday from the state's Capital Program Review Board, clearing the way for the agency to start work on several projects.

The Metropolitan Transportation Authority's much-criticized $17 billion capital plan won final approval yesterday from the state's Capital Program Review Board, clearing the way for the agency to start work on several projects.

The plan includes preparation for a Second Avenue subway line from 125th Street to Lower Manhattan, construction of a Long Island Rail Road link to Grand Central Terminal and the purchase of 1,000 buses.
